verses.verse: And Samson<WH8123> went down<WH3381> to Timnath<WH8553>, and saw<WH7200> a woman<WH802> in Timnath<WH8553> of the daughters<WH1323> of the Philistines<WH6430>.

And he came up<WH5927>, and told<WH5046> his father<WH1> and his mother<WH517>, and said<WH559>, I have seen<WH7200> a woman<WH802> in Timnath<WH8553> of the daughters<WH1323> of the Philistines<WH6430>: now therefore get<WH3947> her for me to wife<WH802>.

Then his father<WH1> and his mother<WH517> said<WH559> unto him, Is there never<WH369> a woman<WH802> among the daughters<WH1323> of thy brethren<WH251>, or among all my people<WH5971>, that thou goest<WH1980> to take<WH3947> a wife<WH802> of the uncircumcised<WH6189> Philistines<WH6430>? And Samson<WH8123> said<WH559> unto his father<WH1>, Get<WH3947> her for me; for she pleaseth me well<WH3474><WH5869>.

But his father<WH1> and his mother<WH517> knew<WH3045> not that it was of the LORD<WH3068>, that he sought<WH1245> an occasion<WH8385> against the Philistines<WH6430>: for at that time<WH6256> the Philistines<WH6430> had dominion<WH4910> over Israel<WH3478>.

¶ Then went<WH3381> Samson<WH8123> down<WH3381>, and his father<WH1> and his mother<WH517>, to Timnath<WH8553>, and came<WH935> to the vineyards<WH3754> of Timnath<WH8553>: and, behold, a young<WH3715> lion<WH738> roared<WH7580> against<WH7125> him.

And the Spirit<WH7307> of the LORD<WH3068> came mightily<WH6743> upon him, and he rent<WH8156> him as he would have rent<WH8156> a kid<WH1423>, and he had nothing<WH3972> in his hand<WH3027>: but he told<WH5046> not his father<WH1> or his mother<WH517> what he had done<WH6213>.
And he went down<WH3381>, and talked<WH1696> with the woman<WH802>; and she pleased<WH3474> Samson<WH8123> well<WH3474><WH5869>.

¶ And after a time<WH3117> he returned<WH7725> to take<WH3947> her, and he turned aside<WH5493> to see<WH7200> the carcase<WH4658> of the lion<WH738>: and, behold, there was a swarm<WH5712> of bees<WH1682> and honey<WH1706> in the carcase<WH1472> of the lion<WH738>.

And he took<WH7287> thereof in his hands<WH3709>, and went on<WH3212> eating<WH398>, and came<WH1980> to his father<WH1> and mother<WH517>, and he gave<WH5414> them, and they did eat<WH398>: but he told<WH5046> not them that he had taken<WH7287> the honey<WH1706> out of the carcase<WH1472> of the lion<WH738>.
¶ So his father<WH1> went down<WH3381> unto the woman<WH802>: and Samson<WH8123> made<WH6213> there a feast<WH4960>; for so used the young men<WH970> to do<WH6213>.
And it came to pass, when they saw<WH7200> him, that they brought<WH3947> thirty<WH7970> companions<WH4828> to be with him.

¶ And Samson<WH8123> said<WH559> unto them, I will now put forth<WH2330> a riddle<WH2420> unto you: if ye can certainly<WH5046> declare<WH5046> it me within the seven<WH7651> days<WH3117> of the feast<WH4960>, and find it out<WH4672>, then I will give<WH5414> you thirty<WH7970> sheets<WH5466> and thirty<WH7970> change<WH2487> of garments<WH899>:

But if ye cannot<WH3201> declare<WH5046> it me, then shall ye give<WH5414> me thirty<WH7970> sheets<WH5466> and thirty<WH7970> change<WH2487> of garments<WH899>. And they said<WH559> unto him, Put forth<WH2330> thy riddle<WH2420>, that we may hear<WH8085> it.

And he said<WH559> unto them, Out of the eater<WH398> came forth<WH3318> meat<WH3978>, and out of the strong<WH5794> came forth<WH3318> sweetness<WH4966>. And they could<WH3201> not in three<WH7969> days<WH3117> expound<WH5046> the riddle<WH2420>.

And it came to pass on the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117>, that they said<WH559> unto Samson's<WH8123> wife<WH802>, Entice<WH6601> thy husband<WH376>, that he may declare<WH5046> unto us the riddle<WH2420>, lest we burn<WH8313> thee and thy father's<WH1> house<WH1004> with fire<WH784>: have ye called<WH7121> us to take that we have<WH3423>? is it not so?

And Samson's<WH8123> wife<WH802> wept<WH1058> before him, and said<WH559>, Thou dost but hate<WH8130> me, and lovest<WH157> me not: thou hast put forth<WH2330> a riddle<WH2420> unto the children<WH1121> of my people<WH5971>, and hast not told<WH5046> it me. And he said<WH559> unto her, Behold, I have not told<WH5046> it my father<WH1> nor my mother<WH517>, and shall I tell<WH5046> it thee?

And she wept<WH1058> before him the seven<WH7651> days<WH3117>, while their feast<WH4960> lasted<WH1961>: and it came to pass on the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117>, that he told<WH5046> her, because she lay sore<WH6693> upon him: and she told<WH5046> the riddle<WH2420> to the children<WH1121> of her people<WH5971>.

And the men<WH582> of the city<WH5892> said<WH559> unto him on the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117> before the sun<WH2775> went down<WH935>, What is sweeter<WH4966> than honey<WH1706>? and what is stronger<WH5794> than a lion<WH738>? And he said<WH559> unto them, If<WH3884> ye had not plowed<WH2790> with my heifer<WH5697>, ye had not found out<WH4672> my riddle<WH2420>.

¶ And the Spirit<WH7307> of the LORD<WH3068> came<WH6743> upon him, and he went down<WH3381> to Ashkelon<WH831>, and slew<WH5221> thirty<WH7970> men<WH376> of them, and took<WH3947> their spoil<WH2488>, and gave<WH5414> change<WH2487> of garments unto them which expounded<WH5046> the riddle<WH2420>. And his anger<WH639> was kindled<WH2734>, and he went up<WH5927> to his father's<WH1> house<WH1004>.
But Samson's<WH8123> wife<WH802> was given to his companion<WH4828>, whom he had used as his friend<WH7462>.
